intro: Cupania distachya, commonly known as the slender cupuaçu, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in catkins, and it is known for its edible fruits, which are similar to those of the cupuaçu. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and agricultural studies.
